sentence.text: Clinical examination of patient 3 at age 17 years: height 132 cm (well below 3rd centile), weight 30.3 kg (below 3rd centile), OFC 53 cm (2nd centile), ICD 37 mm (above 97th centile), OCD 85 mm (25â€“50th centile), PFL 22 mm (well below 3rd centile).

He had blepharophimosis, telecanthus, blepharoptosis, epicanthus inversus, arched eyebrows, a repaired bilateral cleft lip and palate (Fig. 1), periumbilical depression, and sexual infantilism (Tanner's scale: G1, P1).
Ophthalmological examination showed exotropia and amblyopia on the left eye and astigmatism in both eyes.
Audiological evaluation disclosed moderate bilateral conductive hearing loss.
Ultrasound studies showed a crossed-fused renal ectopy and true left cryptorchidism.

Endocrinologic evaluation revealed growth hormone deficiency (absence of growth hormone response to insulin-induced hypoglycaemia) and secondary hypogonadism (decreased testosterone, FSH and LH levels).
Serum insulin-like growth factor (IGF-1) and IGF binding protein 3 (IGFBP-3) concentrations were low and normal respectively.
